original: Broman, Robert Olof Lars, läroverksadjunkt, Skara, f. 19/5/06 i Vä-nersb. av ’tandläk. Robert B. o. Anna Lindberg. G. 36 m. Marg-it Torell. Barn: Anna-Greta f. 36. — Stud:ex. i Vänersb. 24, fil. kand. i Upps. 27, fil. mag. 28, provår v. folksk:sem. i Sthlm 38-39. Res. t. Tyskl. 22, 32, Balkan (Jugoslav.)_ 31, Finl. 29. Tim-lär. v. h. a. 1. å Östermalm i Sthlm 32-33, vik. lektor i Visby 33-34, i Häl-singb. 34, e. adj. i Nässjö 35, vik. lektor v. Umeå folkskisem. 36-38, komm. lektor i Arvika 39-40, e. o. adj. i Värnamo 40-41, ord. ämneslär. i Sveg 41-46, adj. i Skara fr. 46. Förest, f. fö-refåsn :fören, i Sveg 44-46. Rektor f. Skara ’Stads isk. f. yrkesund :viisn. 47. Se kr. i Skara hum. förb. Medl. av Frimurarorden.
translated: Broman, Robert Olof Lars, high school teacher, from Skara. Born on May 19, 1906 in Vänersborg to 'dentist Robert B. and Anna Lindberg'. Married in 1936 to Margit Torell. They have one child: Anna-Greta, born in 1936. He graduated from high school in Vänersborg in 1924, obtained a Bachelor of Arts degree in Uppsala in 1927, a Master of Arts degree in 1928 and completed a year of teaching training at a school in Stockholm from 1938-1939. He travelled to Germany in 1922 and 1932, Yugoslavia in 1931, and Finland in 1929. He worked as an hourly-paid teacher in Stockholm from 1932-1933, as a substitute lecturer in Visby from 1933-1934, as a lecturer in Helsingborg in 1934, as an assistant teacher in Nässjö in 1935, as a substitute lecturer at Umeå's primary school from 1936-1938, as a municipal lecturer in Arvika from 1939-1940, as an acting assistant teacher in Värnamo from 1940-1941, as a regular subject teacher in Sveg from 1941-1946, and as an assistant teacher in Skara from 1946 onwards. He was the chairman of the Sveg's former student association from 1944-1946. In 1947, he became the principal of the Skara City School of Professional Studies. He is a member of the Freemason's Order.

employer.name: Skara City School of Professional Studies
